Key Arguments: The legislation lacks transparency and accountability, with unelected bureaucrats deciding what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The vague definition of 'harm' allows for potential misuse against dissenting opinions.
The exemption of government and educational institutions from the legislation suggests a bias towards promoting a specific narrative.
The legislation infringes on freedom of speech and democratic principles.
It violates rights under the Declaration of Human Rights (article 12).
Notable Quotes: The basis of a true free democracy is the contest of ideas which requires freedom of speech.
It is textbook 1984 Ministry of Truth and has no place in Australian law and life.
